thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Why Harvard Is Becoming an Almond Farmer

author: Lucy Craymer
title: Why Harvard Is Becoming an Almond Farmer
text:
In the Australian state of New South Wales, Harvard University is developing around 1,480 acres of former potato fields and other farmland, building a new dam and planting trees that will take about three years to bear their first edible crops.
It is part of a growing bet on almonds by the collegeâ€™s endowment, which is adding to around 1,235 acres of almond plantations it already owns near a township called Hillston. Hundreds of miles away, Harvard is trying to sell an Australian sugar-cane plantation that it bought in 2016...
